characters: WOULD YOU JUST GET OUTTA HERE
SLUTNIK, CORTEZ, FLEA, STAMM, ENGLAND, NEWBERRY, WICKWIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding in their white uniforms, naval flag officers sit in the audience, showing their support for THEODORE HAYES a 50-year-old civilian.  This is his confirmation hearing Reading from prepared material:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... last few years have brought many advances in the interests of women in naval service, particularly in the land-based maritime specialties. What's more, the Navy has instituted special sensitivity courses with an eye on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.  "Land-based maritime specialties." Gimme a second here to de-euphemize that... At the center of a dais, LILLIAN DEHAVEN leans back to ponder the ceiling of the hearing room.  Her plaque card reads "CHAIRPERSON -- SENATE ARMS COMMITTEE." DeHaven is tough-hided old Southern belle, Scarlett O'Hara at 60. In her arsenal she carries conversational hand-grenades - and she's apt to pull a pin at the slightest whim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that be anything like "typing"?  "Restocking the cupboards"?  That sort of thing, Mr. Hayes? CHUCKLES from the packed gallery.  The flag officers go stone-faced.  Hayes forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly the case, Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm just an old dame without much time left, so you'll pardon me if I jump right in here before they discontinue my blood-type.  I am deeply concerned over the Navy's seemingly incontrovertible attitude toward women in the military.  Case in point... On cue, aides begin distributing reports to other members of the dais.  Hayes gets a copy, too.  And it jars him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Lark Report."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Senator... this is an internal document of the U.S. Navy.  I must seriously question whether --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others on panel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navy's conclusion regarding the crash of an F-14 aboard an aircraft carrier.  Female aviator, it just so happens. (to Hayes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're familiar with this report and its conclusion, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was one member of the investigating commission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I see your signature right here -- twice the size of everyone else's.  And your conclusion was "pilot error," hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really not prepared for any kind of in-depth review of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to think our next Secretary of the Navy would be prepared for anything, Mr. Hayes. A humorless smile.  She's roasting his nuts over an open fire, and everyone knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commission concluded that the aviator in question failed to execute a proper approach to the carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That aside for the moment, I'm struck by the tenor, the ill-spirit of your report... the degrading remarks by other aviators... innuendo about her performance in unrelated situations... even a reference to her sexual activity the weekend prior. (closing report)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my seven years on this committee, I've never seen a downed aviator treated like this.  Never.  I'm deeply disturbed by this report, Mr. Hayes.  Not just what it bodes for women in the military -- but for your own confirmation as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading for her office, DeHaven is escorted by a small PRESS RETINUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a full 35 percent of all jobs in the U.S. military are still, to this day, off-limits to women.  And that's simply gotta change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those who say women aren't suited for all jobs?  That they're physically weaker... they have less stamina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  And we're gonna hog the bathroom, too. DEHAVEN'S AIDE catches up, pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White House boys want a private meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll act surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoes dumped on her desk, DeHaven changes out knee-high stockings while devoting one ear to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to reassure you that he has every faith in the ability of Mr. Hayes to guide the Navy into the next century.  The task, as the Administration sees it, is to acknowledge changing realities without losing traditional values. A beat.  DeHaven looks between the two WHITE HOUSE boys - #1 young and eager, #2 older and cagier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Zat it?  Ten minutes, nothin' on the table?  Sweetcakes, you best go back to the President and tell him to open up the phone book and start lookin' for his next nominee. White House #1 looks spanked.  Taking over, #2 pops a briefcase.  An inch-think report appears before DeHaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Administration's plan for 100 percent integration.  If female candidates measure up in a series of test cases, the President will support full integration within three years' time. Surprised -- maybe even startled -- DeHaven flips through the report, absorbing by osmosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your gender-blind Navy, Senator.  Surely you're not going to balk now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's just that askin' you all to integrate the Navy is like sending a man to do a woman's job. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you propose to handle the Combat Exclusion Laws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep narrowing the definitions. Keep redefining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got around it in Saudi Arabia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By calling women "Honorary Men." Ingenious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Senator, President's pitchin' right down the center of your plate. If women measure up to men, they've got the job.  You going to take a swing?  Or step out of the box? DeHaven riffles the edges of the report, thinking it over Thinking light years ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buttoning up topcoats, the White House boys move down marble steps to reach a pair of limousines.  Hayes and tw FLAG OFFICERS wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mr. Secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the moving car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she picks the women, we pick the programs.  Seals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go Special Reconnaissance. Every bit as tough -- and we have a 60 percent drop-out rate among the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suggest we start there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter who she picks.  No woman is going to last one week in a commando training course.  And I don't care who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winterscape:  Dotted with ice floes, the Potomac wends through the capitol city, banks iridescent with snow, morning water calm.  There's an almost hallowed beauty to it all.  Soon we pick out... A spot of day-glo.  Coming out of the mouth of morning. Overtaking the floes. CLOSER on JORDAN O'NEIL.  She pushes her flat-water kayak downriver, paddling hard and clean, making good time. Gliding through the graceful arches of the Arlington bridge, she passes... Cars overhead.  Grid-locked by snow conditions. In seconds Jordan paddles clear, leaving the traffic behind as she heads toward the Washington Monument. Something BURRS from a life-vest pocket.  She rips throug velcro to free a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta situation here.  Where are you?  Stuck in traffic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking dive watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not due in for 22 minutes, sir. Watcha got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, stand by, we're going to switch over to COMSAT... A TACTICAL OFFICER reroutes the call via defense satellite, cryptography flashing on terminals.  Lieutenan Commander ROBERT ROYCE joins other Intel officers at a conference table.  They're pouring over weather charts, navigation logs, high-altitude NRO video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice-system now secure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fresh stuff:  Lost a NATO plane over the Sea of Japan.  ELB signals leads us to believe the pilot is alive and has made his way to the North Korean shore, near a fishing village, "Tamyung."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we know it's him using the beacon?  Not a decoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signals received only sparingly, in such a pattern that leads us to conclude it is a downed aviator trying to conserve his batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chances of recovery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the analyst for East China, O'Neil.  Analyze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding the current, Jordan blows a troubled sigh as she accesses the file of her brain.  Drifting past the Jefferson Memorial:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North Korean beaches are the best protected, most heavily monitored in the world.  The civilian population is so propagandized that it acts as an Early Warning system.  Extraction team has to be small and silent -- I'd go with Seals over Delta Force. Problem is, don't want to hold a conventional sub off-shore for target practice.  Where's The Polk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway 'round the world.  So that's the problem -- we can get the team in, just not out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an inspired beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you Whiskey Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blank faces here, O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick-hit technique used by Capone. Rigged a getaway car with running boards and handles.  All his guys had to do was jump on and take a ride.  Check the files -- DPRK-57 -- I doped it out as a contingency plan:  Seal Team infiltrates, picks up the package, links up with recovery sub.  But don't waste time opening and closing hatches.  They just grab the periscope and hang on for neutral waters. A dubious beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect the extraction team to ride the sub bare-back?  Is that correct, O'Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only four minutes to neutral waters, sir.  Why not? Silence on the radio:  They're discussing her scenario privately.  During, Jordan's kayak reaches the junction o the Potomac and the Anacostia rivers.  On the far bank lies... Naval Intel Center (N.I.C.), bristling with communication antennae. Jordan stares at the complex, waiting for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, sending the recommendation across the river. Royce out. The phone goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bundled in topcoat and scarves, military and civilian employees transit a security station on their way inside. Presently Jordan appears -- wearing a wetsuit and balancing a collapsed kayak on her head.  She flashes a photo-badge and double-times inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan exits a locker room.  Smoothing out her Khaki uniform, she heads down a broad corridor with cipher-lock doors.  Falling in step:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good headwork, lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.  We hear back from the Pentagon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably hear back from CNN first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate this part.  Just sweating it out on the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intel has its own glory, lieutenant -- no matter how subtle. Now they reach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circular chamber.  Dominating the ground floor is the bullpen, a hive of cubicles an computer stations.  On the second floor are executive offices, ringing the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I'll need that option paper by 11-hundred today so I can review it with Admiral Hanover.  And do we have any of that breakfast tea around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this my glory, sir? On the upper walkway, a frazzled N.I.C. SECRETARY appears.  She spots Royce and Jordan below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but I have Senator DeHaven on the line for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus God, what now? He bounds up the stairs toward his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir no -- she asked to speak with Lieutenant O'Neil. Royce turns back and gives Jordan a hall-of-fame look. "Oh, really?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everyone I talk to says you're top drawer with silk stockings inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am.  Um, may I ask what this is regarding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-school pentathlete... ROTC scholarship, graduated with honors... top marks in Basic Training... and, as it just so happens, a constituent of my home state of Virginia.  Oh, the things I'll do for one extra vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone, Jordan glances around.  Co-workers mull within earshot.  Those out of earshot post E-mail memos o Jordan's computer:  "Moving up in life."  "I want a full report."  "Don't tell her who you really voted for."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant O'Neil, I am prepared to nominate you for the Navy's Special Reconnaissance program.  Should you accept, you'll ship out to Coronado next week and join in the big testosterone festival.  Complete the course, and you'll have a fast ticket to any assignment you want. That's my personal promise to you. A beat as Jordan's mind catches up to her ears.  Now INTERRCUTTING the two:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Coronado."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, sir.  Ma'am.  It's just that... Beggin' your pardon, Senator, but... do you understand that this involves combat training?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just a test case, O'Neil. But if it works out -- if you work out -- it could well change the Navy's official policy on women in combat.  Or, actually, its official non-policy.  Now who's your immediate superior there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Dwyer.  Technically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office will fill him in and help expedite.  Look forward to meeting you at the proper time.  Jumping off now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, question, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I be the only one?  The only woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be more to follow -- but yes, dear, right now you're the pick of a very large litter.  And your success would mean a lot.  Jumping, now... The line goes dead.  Jordan hangs up catatonically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit-a-doodle-do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small gunkhole harbor up the Potomac.  Snow falls thick and silent on overturned canoes, stored for the winter. Beyond stands a clapboard rental house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so much furnished as equipped -- scuba gear and wetsuits in the mud room, life vests on coat racks, a training bag and boxing gloves hanging in the living room In the kitchen we find... A naked man.  He's steeping tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... well, I survived Basic Training and three brothers -- so I know how to fight.  What scares me are the sexual politics.  I don't want to be turned into some poster girl for women's rights. CAMERA FOLLOWS as the naked man carries a steaming mug through the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and sets it down beside Jordan, languishing in a tub. Snow builds on a window sill.  Facing Jordan, the man slides into the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why're you even considering it? Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spec-Recon.  Those guys are world- class warriors.  And they will not want you there, Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you don't either.  Feet. Dutifully, Royce massages her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're doin' shit-hot at Intel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce.  We're the same age, we started the same time -- and now you're sitting in the upperdecks while I'm still down in the bullpen. What does that tell you about the Navy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's haze grey and underway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need operational duty to really advance... you need combat training to go operational... yet combat training is off-limits to people with tits.  I'm topped out at Intel. Forget the glass ceiling -- I'm beating my head on a big brass ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So dump on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, guess I don't even need to be here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your dick back here.  It has everything to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a ball-breaker sometimes.  Especially at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  But after our days... (a thoughtful sip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I try this thing... if I ship out to Coronado... what happens here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to keep the door open.  If you wash out, I make it so that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wai', wait.  What happens if it works?  Four months of training, three years of operational duty. What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like doing an option paper on the rest of my life, Jordan.  Maybe we should just let it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is guy-speak for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conceding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounded lame as soon as it came out of my mouth.  But I'm trying to be honest, okay?  Three years is a long time.  Don't ask me to predict how I'll feel then, Jordan, because I don't know.  And either do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, right up until you said that -- I thought I did know. Wounded, she gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Royce.  It was shaping up like such a tough call -- and then you go and make it so goddamn easy. Really, thank you so much. She punches into a robe and leaves.  Royce considers drowning himself in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan drives a top-down Mustang across the sweeping Coronado Bridge, cityscape behind her, naval base ahead. A flock of pelicans pace Jordan alongside the bridge. Suddenly two NAVY HELOS BLAST overhead, scattering the pelicans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On base, Jordan carries a gunnysack across an asphalt courtyard.  The is "the grinder," reminiscent of a gladiator's arena.  She notices at one end... A silver ship's bell.  Hung prominently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, lieutenant.  I was told this is where I check in. A DUTY OFFICER looks up to find Jordan across a counter. In no particular hurry, the duty officer makes his way over to check Jordan's orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the one. Hearing, other workers look up.  Among them is a female ensign, KATHY BLONDELL -- no makeup, no nail polish, no concession to her sex.  Throughout, she'll watch Jordan with more than passing interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still don't have my bearings yet. Direct me to the officer's quarters? The duty officer stamps her paperwork, returns it with room assignment and keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll proceed directly to the infirmary for eye tests, blood tests, urinalysis, pregnancy test. Uniform issue adjacent.  Then you're to report to the Base Commander. He'd like a word with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  And the officer's quarters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.O.'s office can supply you with directions.  Enjoy your visit, lieutenant. It's a nasty little barb -- one that Jordan decides to le slide.  Jordan turns for the door.  Blondell catches up with a base map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B.O.Q., south side.  Take a starboard tack out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ensign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft KNOCKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. A YEOMAN opens the door.  Behind him is Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant j.g. O'Neil reporting, sir. For a beat, COMMANDING OFFICER (C.O.) TURRENTINE takes stock of the female in his doorway, sizing her up like a fighter across the ring.  Then he stubs out a perfectly good cigar, rises with an amiable face, and touches the back of a chair -- stopping just short of pulling it out for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  Please, have a seat, lieutenant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care for a beverage?  Tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  We're still coming to terms with the exact protocol for this -- for integrating the Spec-Recon training.  It may not always be smooth, but we're trying to make it as painless as possible for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.  But I expect a certain amount of pain. More stock-taking.  Is he looking at her hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barber was my next stop, sir. Would've had it regulation sooner, only --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.  If it's off your collar and out of your eyes, that's all I'm going to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, I have no problem with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not out to change your sex, lieutenant.  You'll have separate beds, separate heads.  If you have specific medical needs, inform the infirmary.  If a classmate or superior acts in an harassing or otherwise unbecoming manner, please inform me immediately so I can deal with it immediately.  Questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None at this time, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's all I have to say. Dismissed. Another smile, another phantom gesture on the back of her chair.  If Jordan was expecting a fight, the bell never sounded.  She rises, salutes -- then turns back at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I just want you to know... I'm not here to make a statement.  I don't want to make men look foolish. All I care about is completing the training and getting operational experience -- just like everyone else, I suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were like everyone else, lieutenant, I suspect we wouldn't be making statements about not making statements, would we? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spec-Recon TRAINEES loiter outside their open rooms, pumping weights, hosing down dive gear, trading Walkman tapes.  This is the last day of liberty they'll have for long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I scannin' here? Other eyes quickly lock in on... Jordan.  Across a grass courtyard, she walks the ground floor of an identical building, trying to match key numbe to room number.  Every door is open, every room empty. Soon she feels the presence of... The men.  They're disgorging from their rooms -- ten, twenty, thirty of them -- all buffed and cut.  These guys are what Hitler saw in his dreams. Jordan picks up her pace.  Where the hell is her room? On all three levels of their building, the men shadow Jordan en masse.  Not hooting.  Not leering.  Just assessing. Jordan finds her room at the far corner of the building: She's got the entire floor to herself.  With a last look over her shoulder, Jordan vanishes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Reconnaissance.  Here you will be trained to infiltrate hostile territory... to be the real- time eyes on the ground... to recover assigned targets and, if need be, to fight your way out under adverse conditions. CAMERA SURVEYS faces of the trainees:  MILLER, MCCOOL,

dialogues.speaker: SLUTNIK, CORTEZ, FLEA, STAMM, ENGLAND, NEWBERRY, WICKWIRE
dialogues.text: We'll get to know them later.  Dressed in Navy greens, they stand in formation -- ten rows, ten deep, helmets in hand.  Pacing before them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is all that will be said about the special nature of this class -- by us or by you.  Many of you have waited years for admission to this program.  Opportunities like this are rare -- and those who seize upon them are rarer still. He approaches Jordan.  We can tell what she's thinking. "Just keep moving.  Don't single me out."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than that, there is little to be said but "Good luck, gentleman." (correcting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gentlepersons." Jordan flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I turn you over to the chief training officer.  He has earned six naval commendations, the purple heart, and the Navy Cross for heroism and valor.  I give you Master Chief John James Urgayle. Taking over, THE CHIEF stands before the class a moment, sizing them up while giving them -- get an eyeload of him too:  His body is 30 years old, his face 40, his eyes 50. An ageless warrior.  Somewhere, the blood of Ulysses runs in this guy's veins. The Chief lifts a bullhorn to deliver his opening salvo - and it's anything but the kick-ass rant the class is expecting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun and moon... the ebb and flow of the Pacific tides... global warming... the very angle of the Earth upon its axis... these are just some of the things I control in my world. Trainees swap private looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darth Vader reads poetry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are so fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on boots, crashing through shallow surf, spraying water.  We assume this is a routine beach run -- until VIEW RISES to reveal... Telephone poles on their shoulder.  Working in groups of 10, trainees labor under 300-pound poles.  Jordan, six inches shorter than most, looks like Atlas carrying the weight of the world.  But she's doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count down... one, two... count down... three, four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four... One, two, three, four... An ambulance shadows the class.  Perched on the front bumper like an hood-ornament, the Chief keeps working his bullhorn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may think that you are the brightest, the best, the strongest. I assure you, that is a total delusion on your part.  It is my job to show you just how weak human beings can truly be.  60 percent of you will not finish this course. How do I know?  Because that is an historical fact. It's also intimidating shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poles down. The earth literally shakes as the phone poles hit the dam sand.  Approaching on foot, the Chief loads fresh batteries into his bullhorn.  He does it like a man thumbing rounds into a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now for the bad new:  I always like to get one quitter on the first day. And until I do, the first day does not end.  So look around right now -- go on, do it.  I wonder who it's gonna be... He passes right by Jordan, never meeting her eyes. INSTRUCTOR PYRO steps up.  He's the Chief's bulldog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down to BVDs! The guys strip down to boxers.  Jordan settles for boxers and jog bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now face the Pacific... link arms... and take a stroll! The class wades in.  The first wave takes Jordan's breath away:  It's February, and the water is cold.  When they move out of instructors' earshot:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with the damn phone poles?  We sign up for Spec-Recon or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to thin the herd. That's all they want to do right now. Some of the guys are glancing Jordan's way, cashing in on a cheap wet T-shirt contest.  Jordan covers herself instinctively -- and hates the instinct.  Modesty isn't going to get her through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man.  Doesn't she know it's rude to point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  You see that girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got eyes, Newberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night.  Just one night in my room, she'd forget all about playin' commando.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tone that shit down, Slutnik.  You heard with they said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the water! The class breaks for the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now make like sugar cookies and roll in the sand for me. The trainees hit their bellies and roll.  Indeed, they look like sugar cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collect those poles, gentlemen. Still a lotta beachfront you haven't seen... Groaning, the trainees grab poles.  Jordan's pole, wet slips from their collective grasp... And bangs Stamm's ankle.  He HOWLS through his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad?  Stamm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get a medic over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, goddamnit.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up!  Up!  Up!  Up! Stamm swallows the pain.  Poles go back on shoulders. Looking like drunk centipedes, the class staggers off dow the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallowing in mud, the class does belly-busters, atomic sit-ups -- and the sadistic reverse push-up, where trainees lie of their backs, place hands under shoulder blades and push their crotches skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain is your friend.  You ally.  It will keep you awake in times of emergency... it will tell you when you are seriously injured... it will keep you angry and remind you to finish the job and get the hell home.  But you know the best thing about pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lets you know that you aren't dead yet. Instructors roam, RASPING ORDERS, kicking students into proper position.  Jordan struggles with the reverses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go regulation if you can't do the reverses, O'Neil. She looks around.  A lot of the guys are having trouble with the reverses, not just her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.  But I like these just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not doin' them very fine, O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try anyway, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll try what we tell you to try, O'Neil.  Go regulation. She switches to standard push-ups, her face disappearing into the ooze with every downstroke.  Soon the Chief's boots slosh into FRAME.  He's still looking for his human sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's it gonna be.  I just wonder, who is it gonna be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your belly... on your back... on your feet... on your belly... on your back... on your feet... Whistle-drills.  Silhouetted against a lowering sun, the students flop around like docked fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blondell is ending her shift.  She shoulders a purse and pauses at a window, seeing... The trainees shuffling into formation like the living dead.  Jordan is still among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have noticed a ship's bell hanging at the west side of this courtyard.  If, at any time, you feel you cannot continue with your training -- that bell is your salvation.  Strike it three times, and the ordeal is over. Nervous eyes flick to the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is a long walk.  So I'll make it as easy as I can. He turns his back to the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you don't have to watch me watching you break rank.  Because I know someone here wants to do it. CAMERA SEARCHES their faces.  There isn't one trainee her who hasn't thought about it.  Including Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know what you're thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin' we could jump him right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Can I really take 15 weeks of this bubonic asshole?"  If you don't know the answer to that question, the answer is "No, you cannot."  And that is another historical fact.  So do it.  Admit you don't have what it takes... admit you are out of your depth -- or we're all heading back to the beach right now. (waiting a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instructors!  Time hack! Following the Chief's lead, Instructors lift their dive watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six... five... four... three... two... one... HACK! (to class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time is now 12-hundred.  The sun is shining brightly.  Plenty of daylight left for another phone-pole run... GROANS behind him.  The groans give way to the SOUND OF BOOTS breaking rank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLONDELL'S POV:  Of a lone figure crossing to the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CLOSEUPS of Miller, Slutnik, Wickwire, turning to watch someone cross the grinder.  At least we know who it isn't. CLOSE on the Chief as the BELL RINGS THREE TIMES.  He turns around to find... Stamm at the bell. For the first time, the Chief looks dead-bang at Jordan. Was he expecting her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave your helmet there, Stamm. Back to the barracks. Stamm drops his helmet and limps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of you should remember one thing.  The only easy day was today. Lieutenant Wickwire?  Turning it over to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuh-lass, face right! They march off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead-ass tired, Jordan slides her tray down the line, piling on food that means nothing more than raw calories. She heads for... A table of trainees, one spot open.  Seeing her coming, the guys shift position.  Suddenly the table is full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better look elsewhere, O'Neil. Jordan glares.  None of them meet her eyes.  She wheels around -- and now all eyes are on her, watching her ass walk away.  FEATURE Slutnik, the walking sperm bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a night, Lord, just gimme half a night to set her straight... Jordan tries another table.  This one, too, becomes abruptly full.  As Jordan leaves, HOLD on Miller.  He's a human eclipse -- six-three, 220, the perfect commando physique.  Instructors wish they could clone him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Average woman is 25 percent body fat.  That's one-quarter fat, man. Think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice distribution, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way does she makes this program. No way. After wandering the mess hall like a homeless person, Jordan finds refuge at a table with female mess stewards. They look at her with blank faces.  No understanding.  No compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan walks in a bathrobe, toweling her hair dry.  She fishes for keys at her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so much that they hate you... Jordan looks.  Someone is sitting on an outdoor table, smoking.  He leans into the light so she can see his face It's Wickwire, the mid-30s lieutenant who doubles as clas officer.  He's dangerously handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're more afraid of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now I feel so much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was made clear before you came -- harassment equals career suicide. Can't say anything good, so they don't say much at all.  To your face, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose orders were those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was made clear. (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, stay ballsy.  First week's hell, then it levels out.  Until S.E.R.E. training, anyway.  That's hell-and-a-half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made it to Week 10 last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know they let you try again.  Especially at your age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kind of a surprise yourself. A faint grin from Wickwire before he shadows back across the courtyard that separates the two B.O.Q. buildings. Back across no-man's land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two beds.  Matching lockers.  A desk, a chair, a mirror. All overwhelmingly dull. Jordan drops the robe off her shoulders to take inventory of her body.  Both sides of her neck are bruised from the phone-pole run.  Her back and thighs are sand-burned. Mirror cuts abound.  She's already a mess. Jordan uncaps some cologne.  It's a vestige of her old life she's not going to surrender.  She sniffs.  Savors. Dabs.  Looks back in the mirror... And breaks out laughing.  It's like dropping a rose in a cesspool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTOGRAPHER stands near a car parked just outside the base.  He's peering through a 600mm lens. PHOTOGRAPHER'S POV:  FOCUSING through cyclone fencing... PANNING past the sand dunes... and finding green-clad trainees gathered at an obstacle course.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OBSTACLE COURSE
dialogues.text: An explosion of sand:  England and Wickwire belly-flop into a sand pit and speed-crawl under barbed wire.  Clear they gain their feet and blitz toward... The rolling logs.  They balance-beam their way to... The rope climb.  Racing to the top, they reach a platform and fling themselves down onto... The high poles.  They land awkwardly, losing their wind and their grip, tumbling into the sand pit below before.. Racing for the finish.  The Chief thumbs a stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England, 88 seconds.  You're good to go for the slide-for-life. Wickwire, roll back till you get south of 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.  Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you kiss to get back in here, anyway? Wickwire dusts off and starts back for... The starting line.  Stepping up next is Cortez, the human fighting cock.  Jordan lines up beside him and psyches up for the first obstacle -- and eight-foot sheer wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, here... He grabs something off a truck and positions it at the base of the wall.  It's a little two-step platform. SNICKERS, MOANS from the guys.  Cortez can barely contain his disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, what is this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mortified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have to use it, O'Neil, but it's gotta go out. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five... four... three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make this wall without --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... two... one... MARK! Cortez blurs away.  Jordan starts a step late. Cortez takes the wall clean.  Eschewing the two-step, Jordan jumps right over it -- but jumps too far out because of it.  She takes the wall awkwardly. INTERCUT the others as they break rank to follow, eager t see Cortez blow her off the course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lesgo, Cortez, LESGO, GO, GO! Cortez belly-flops into the sand pit -- and snags going under the barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit of a saint... Catching up, Jordan clears the wire without a hitch and leads going into... The rolling logs.  They both tight-rope across nimbly and bound on toward... Rope climb.  Jordan starts up at a decent clip -- but Cortez comes from behind like a chimp on white sugar, doubling her speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her, take her here, Cortez... lookit that monkey-man go... hoo- yah, hoo-yah... Cortez reaches the top platform.  Now he's faced with... The high poles.  He's seen others land sideways and pay the price.  Trying another way, Cortez takes a flying leap... And WHUMPS down with legs astraddle.  He tried to cushion the landing with his hands -- and failed magnificently. His balls took the brunt. Jordan WHUMPS down beside him with legs astraddle -- and shoots Cortez a "Hey, no problem" look.  She rolls off th poles... And drops to the pit below.  Cortez lands right behind. Now it's a flat-out sprint for... The finish line.  He takes her at the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez, 93 seconds.  O'Neil, 94. Cortez, do a little rescue-recovery on your gonads and line up again. O'Neil... move ahead. Heading back to the starting line, Jordan wheels around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say again, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.  Move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, this is such bullshit... Others GRUMBLE in commiseration.  Jordan flushes with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, sir, I don't understand why --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Educate her, Pyro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Automatic five-second deduction, which slips you under the wire. It's called "gender-norming," O'Neil -- standard procedure for all females in physical training courses.  Where you been the last few years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What "all females"?  If I'm the only --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice now, I have said the words "move on." He turns his back, leaving no possibility of discussion. Jordan stares after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't live with them, can't kill them.  What's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody throw a tent over this circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low to Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let it go.  If it's in your favor, just shut the hell up and take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in bathrobe, Jordan reaches her door.  She pauses to check... The outdoor table.  No visitors tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan pushes inside -- and stops when she sees the littl two-step platform.  That awful crutch.  Someone has put i beside her bed. Jordan wheels around to check...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men' building.  Slutnik and a few others loiter on a balcony, mirroring her stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hastily dressed, Jordan marches across the base.  Her march turns into an angry run as she cuts through parking lots... jumps hedges... and finally reaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An on-base bungalow.  Jordan bangs on the front door unti the C.O.'S scowling face appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon the hour, sir.  But you told me to come to you immediately if I felt I was being mistreated in any way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't take long. He waves her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, lieutenant, give me a name and specifics, I'll have the X.O. file an action first thing in the morning. (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you, sir.  And it started the day I came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jolted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this double-standard, the separate quarters, the deferential treatment.  It's how you pulled out my chair and nearly served high tea the first time we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was civil, now you're complaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford civility, sir.  How am I supposed to fit in with these guys when you've got me set up as an outsider?  Even if I make it under these rules, I still lose, because there'll always be a flag in my file -- "Yeah, she made it, but..."  I mean, really -- why didn't you just issue me a goddamn petticoat to wear around the base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just have a brain-fart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just barge in here and curse at your base commander?  If so, I regard that as a bonafide brain- fart, and I resent it when people fart inside my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you've resented me from the start, sir. Now, finally, her opponent steps into the ring.  And he's a bare-knuckle brawler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (building)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I resent, lieutenant, is some politician using my base as a test tube for her grand social experiment.  What I resent is the sensitivity training that is now mandatory for my men... the day-care center I have to build where an officer's lounge used to be... and the OB/GYN I have to keep on staff just so someone can keep track of your personal pap smears. (drawing close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But most of all, lieutenant, I resent your perfume, however subtle it may be, competing with the aroma of my fine three-dollar-and-fifty- nine cent cigar, which I will happily put out this very instant if the phallic nature of it happens to offend your goddamn fragile sensibilities.  DOES IT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape doesn't bother me.  It's just that goddamn rotten stench. A dangerous beat -- before the C.O. disengages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  'Least now we're talking the same language. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So one standard.  Is that what you're after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same rules for everyone, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the board, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you just happen to wash out, I won't have to contend with you bitchin' to some hairy-chested female Senator?  And please note I did not identify any one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't dream of it, sir. A deciding beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll get a fair shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get everything you want, O'Neil.  Let's see if you want what you're gonna get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan gets her hair cut to regulation length.  It's over in seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan slaps down old room keys and new orders.  Blondell scans the paperwork with deepening concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This some kind of joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan tosses her belongings into a laundry bag.  She slings the bag over her shoulder, boots aside the hated two-step on her way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... marches across the no-man's land...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and bangs open a door.  Slutnik sits up on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who the shit you think you are?  Comin' in here like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your new roommate. Slutnik's face curdles.  Jordan dumps her bag on an open bunk and starts unpacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody usin' these drawers here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, HEY.  No possibility.  You can't stay in here.  You can't sleep right next to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, the C.O. says I can. She slaps orders on his chest, continues to unpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, lookit this, lookit this -- she's bringin' Tampax in here. C'mon, you got nothin' but rooms over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your desk?  I'll take this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Sex Ape.  I'm here to stay. And if you don't want me for a roommate or classmate, you got two options -- move out or ring out. End of file. Slutnik stalks out.  Jordan fires a look at the innocent bystander here, McCool.  He was studying at his desk when the fireworks began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, McCool?  Any problem with the room assignment? McCool -- an imperturbable black lieutenant -- just goes back to his manuals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's not a job -- it's an adventure."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on flares igniting overhead.  FOLLOW the flares as they parachute down into the surf to illuminate... The class, standing in one long line, arms linked.  As black waves knock out their legs, we're reminded of show girls kicking their way through some macabre review.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firing flare guns and working their bullhorns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 degrees this morning!  That's not a bad water temp, really -- if you're standing where we are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slurred speech, lack of proper motor control, short-term amnesia -- all early signs of hypothermia! Advanced hypothermia is easy to detect in a classmate!  He'll look like he's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body heat.  In situations of extreme cold, you can always count on body heat to keep you alive -- and I do not mean your own.  We will break you of the cultural barriers that dictate you should not invade another man's space.  Are any of you in a situation of extreme cold right now? INTERCUTTING trainees and instructors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why aren't you all over the man next to you? The class pivots 90 degrees and starts to close rank. Behind Jordan, Montgomery (a.k.a. "Flea") hesitates: He's a bantam-weight from Georgia, his manners bred into the bone.  He just can't find a delicate way to grab Jordan without mounting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't feel the other guy's pecker, you ain't in tight enough! I want nuts to butts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Montgomery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flea!  O'Neil!  Why is there a break in that line? Finally Jordan grabs Flea by the neck, pushes him ahead and mounts him.  The class closes down into a long human snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montgomery, why do they call you "Flea"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really "F. Lee Montgomery" -- but that gets whittled down to just "Flea."  For short, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it really has nothing to do with actual brain size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Flea, I appreciate the respect you just showed me.  But I don't need it and don't want it -- not that kind of respect, anyway.  It's just gonna hurt us both, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll work on it, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Chief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check your watch, Pyro.  Seems fast. CAMERA POLLS the grim, blue-lipped faces in the water. Jordan feels Flea starting to shake.  Badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  You okay, Flea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Snot me.  It's him. Two bodies ahead, it's the big bruiser, Miller, who's shuddering.  Jordan feels him shaking through Flea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, my hands... they aren't workin' right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long i'zis for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sposed to be 20-minute intervals, no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear each time's gettin' longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This where you bailed last time, Wick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh-uh -- but wasn't middla February last time, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', Miller?  Miller? No answer.  Bad sign.  On shore:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 minutes... Ignoring, the Chief lifts his bullhorn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, all this is completely voluntary.  For any of you who don't want to continue, Instructor Johns is now serving coffee and danish at the ambulance. A portable light comes on.  Indeed, an instructor is setting up coffee service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any takers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the fuckin' Antichrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wick!  They really got donuts over there?  Or just some'a last night's dinner rolls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look like donuts to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you guys doing?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just askin'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you gonna give it all up for a maple twist?  How dumb you gotta be? That's exactly what they -- Suddenly the line rips apart.  It's Miller, breaking for shore.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Soon the dyke is bursting everywhere:  Four others break rank, following Miller's lead. The deserters stagger onto the beach.  MEDICS close in quick, draping them with blankets, shining flashlights in their faces, asking brain-check question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what day this is... look at me now... what city are you from, sailor... here, look right here... A medic nods to the Chief.  No hypothermia.  Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another minute to think about this?  Huh? (no response; to Miller directly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do any of you want to reconsider? Avoiding his eyes, Miller wags his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnson.  Get 'em out of my scan. It's a death sentence.  As the quitters slouch for the coffee truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By my watch... which, of course appears to be broken... they've been in 27 minutes without the benefit of protective gear. TIGHT on the Chief.  Scanning the remaining trainees. Thinking about holding out out for one more. TIGHT on Jordan.  Knowing who he's waiting for.  Wonderin if she can outlast him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody out. With a SHIVERING CHEER, the trainees stampede ashore, grabbing blankets, trading body-bumps and high-fives. Jordan gets swept up in the esprit:  They've conquered a common enemy.  But when she tries to get high-fived... The guys turn their backs.  It's a cold rebuff, worse the any water. HOLD TIGHT on Jordan.  Shivering.  Watching the guys drif away.  Hating them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Way to gut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Wick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instructors are shuffling muster lists, reorganizing the class.  B.G., the BELL TOLLS again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller.  Thought the guy was made of depleted uranium.  Really didn't expect to lose him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every class has its surprises, Pyro. This one'll be no different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blondell crosses the grinder with another female ensign, tall and striking.  Passing the bell, Blondell checks on... The helmets lined up beneath.  A dozen already. An O.S. CADENCE CALL -- then, led by Wickwire, trainees double-time into the grinder, uniforms drenched from a beach run.  Among them, still, is Jordan.  It brings a Mona Lisa smile to Blondell's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change those clothes, be back here in six minutes!  And I am timing you! The class scatters.  Slutnik hits the brakes when he sees Blondell and her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.  And I only got three minutes apiece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jerking him away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barkin' up the wrong dress, Slutnik. You ain't their type. Overhearing, Jordan snaps a look at Blondell, only now realizing.  Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil!  What're you gawking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading newspaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... last week at Coronado.  The woman, identity unknown, is believed to be the first female candidate for the elite Special Reconnaissance program.  Her presence could signal a shift in the Navy's long-standing policy that excludes women from combat positions." The P.R. FLAK drops the newspaper on the C.O.'s desk. It's the San Diego Tribune.  Under the headline "G.I. JANE," a photo shows a chesty sailor running the obstacle course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking again.  Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inbound now, sir.  Had to pull her out of the dive bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have interview requests from two local TV stations.  And a sociologist from U.C. San Diego called, wanted to know if she could examine the interaction between "G.I. Jane" and the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A sociol..."  Kill the interviews. I don't need civilians nosin' around in matters that are supposed to be covert in nature.  Just kill 'em before this whole thing gets outta con --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator DeHaven calling, sir. The C.O. gets an instant headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base Commander Turrentine speaking. In the Senate barber shop, DeHaven is having her hair colored.  She holds a fax of the Tribune article in one hand, a cell phone in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting like a Scud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, are you of the habit of letting photographers traipse around your base snappin' their fill? These were supposed to have been discreet test cases --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, they stand out on the public highway with telephoto lenses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and now I got reporters from Toadsquat, Iowa, calling my office and askin' what I know about this "G.I. Jane" thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- nothing I can do about it unless you're suggesting I infringe on their civil liberties -- which I'd happily do if you'll just trim a little fat off the Constitution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you truly mouthin' off to a senior member of the Senate Arms Committee?  I mean, I'll give you points for style -- just nothin' for smarts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C.O. double-takes as Jordan enters:  She's sun-burned wind-burned, sand-burned, chapped and chaffed, bloody and soggy.  Her dive suit leaks onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See me, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You makin' friends with the press, lieutenant? He tosses her the paper.  Jordan scans the article as DeHaven continues over speakerphone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, seein's how this thing is out, you let me handle the r.p.m.  From this point forward, I want all press matters coordinated via my office. I'll be god-damned if I'm gonna watch Hayes pull flowers out of his ass and take credit for this one. Him or the President. (aside to beautician)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This my shade?  "Midnight Mahogany"? 'Cuz I'm comin' dangerously close to lookin' like Ronald Reagan here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your prerogative, Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright.  How's our girl doin', anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing right here in my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, dear.  How are they treating you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching C.O.'s eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't complain, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.  Maybe I'll ask when I see you in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be visiting that all-woman's America's cup team in a few weeks -- If I were a gambler, I'd say Dennis O'Conner's days are numbered.  But they're in San Diego, so I thought I'd take a quick promenade of the base. Deafening silence.  We aren't sure who dreads the idea more -- the C.O. or Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, V.I.P. security arrangements generally take some time, Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Security"?  What the hell you talkin' about?  Your base isn't secure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, but there's more --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then set out the good plates, we'll all have lunch.  My office will follow up with details.  Jumping off, now... Phone goes dead.  The C.O. gives Jordan a look one might reserve for a lab technician who inadvertently unleashed Ebola upon the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I want you to know that I had nothing to do with any of this.  Not this article, not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We'll all have lunch."  Good idea. Oh, and let's be sure to invite this sociologist, too -- just in case we want to have a FUCKING BRIDGE GAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?  Secretary Hayes calling. The C.O.'s headache becomes a migraine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to leave, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to evaporate, O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeHaven hands the phone to her aide.  He's set up a portable office in the next barber chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I overplayed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congress and the Pentagon share a lot of plumbing.  They'll never know whose leak it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150-pound rubber boats ("Zodiacs") litter the beach.  The class is breaking down into six-man crews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat Five -- Wickwire, Cozad, Vinyl, Intagliata, Ayers, and Wise. Lieutenant Wickwire is your senior officer.  Follow his orders to your death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it up! Crew Five finds their Zodiac, hoists it onto their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat Six -- England, O'Neil, McCool, Montgomery, Cortez, and Slutnik. Lieutenant England is your senior officer. Jordan rolls her eyes:  At least two of the guys in her crew are blue-ribbon misogynists.  Cortez and Slutnik don't like it any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherachrist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody got a problem with the muster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine by me, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full of joy here, sir! Exchanging looks across their Zodiac, Jordan and her new crewmates lift the boat overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat Seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With BATTLE CRIES, 12 boat crews charge into the teeth of the POUNDING SURF.  Some lose their boat to the first wave; others clear the surf and scramble aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First crew to finish gets hot food and warm racks for the night!  Rest of you are digging hide-sites and eating earthworms tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the breakers, the Zodiacs run parallel to shore, crews paddling furiously, racing the wind, the sun, the other crews.  Instructors shadow in power boats, stopwatches running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna be pickin' no sandcrabs outta my ass tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So shutup and stroke, McCool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo-yah!  Hoo-yah! Flea checks on Jordan.  She paddles hard, really digging in.  Flea grins:  On some level, he has to admire this women. Jordan catches the grin, gives one back. Ahead, buoys mark the finish line.  And just when it seem victory is at hand... THWUNK.  Something hits Boat Six.  Suddenly it's losing air.  Jordan torques around to see... The Chief on a nearby boat, speargun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boat just hit razor coral. What do you do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patch and pump!  C'mon!  Whose ass is on the kit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say keep paddlin'!  We're almost --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, McCool!  Pri One is to save the boat, not win a race!  So let's get on it! They flail to save their sinking boat.  Boat Five noses past, stealing the lead.  Wickwire tosses Jordan a passin look.  "Sorry, but..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and down the dunes, crews are digging "hide-sites" -- six-man holes that will be their homes tonight.  Cortez and Slutnik are uprooting shrubs, collecting camouflage material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years I petition to get into this program.  Four years.  Finally get here, and now it's co-ed?  Such bullshit.  Now I'm gettin' hammered just 'cuz she's on our crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least you don't have to sleep with her every goddamn night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tellin' you, I'd rather be the last class with balls than the first one with chicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Flea fill sand bags to shore up the walls of their hide-site.  England and McCool shovel back to back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had a grandaddy who wanted to be a Navy man.  Wanted to fire them big guns on a big-ass battleship.  But Navy said to him, "Oh, no.  You can only do one thing on a battleship." "Well what's that?" grandaddy said. "Cook," they said.  Now this ain't 100 years ago -- I'm talkin' United States Navy, middla World War II. And you know the reason they gave him?  You know why they tol' my grandaddy he couldn't fight for his country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Negroes can't see at night.  Bad night vision."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kiddin' me. Jordan jumps in the hole, ready to take over shoveling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, you just the new nigger on the block, O'Neil.  That's all.  And maybe you moved in too early. He climbs out.  HOLD on Jordan, looking off down the dunes, seeing the other crews covering up and going underground for the night.  How the hell did she wind up here?  So far from home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jeep speeds along the public highway, carrying the C.O. back to base.  When the Jeep tops a rise:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's name... Ahead, a half-dozen news crews are camped on the shoulder All cameras are trained on the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Navy dress blues laid out on a bed... topcoa draped on a chair-back... CNN on a television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is denying that it is considering changing its long-held policy of exclusion -- but it isn't denying the presence of at least one female in a heretofore all-male program.  Dubbed "G.I. Jane" by the media, this woman is now undergoing commando training at the Special Warfare Command Center in San Diego... Half-shaven, Royce leans out of the bathroom in time to catch... Footage from Coronado:  A woman in Navy greens is on a beach run, loaded down with backpack and M-16.  The NEWS FOOTAGE ZOOMS IN, FREEZE FRAMES with the indelible image that will be used over and over in coming weeks:  Woman cradling rifle.  Madonna for the 21st century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn.  My poster girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator DeHaven's office still has not released the identity of the woman, but DeHaven is confirming that "G.I. Jane" has outlasted many of her male counter-parts in the program, said to be one of the most grueling anywhere.  Joining us now on "Washington Tonight" for the feminist perspective is Gloria Allred, live from -- Royce snaps it off.  He can't take anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the coffered ceiling of a great Beau-Art hall, on of Washington's power-tribes is celebrating.  We find gowned women, tuxedoed men, gold-braided naval officers, SWING BAND, and... Secretary Hayes, newly confirmed.  He beams as he dances with his wife.  Compliments and friendly barbs come from all directions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mr. Secretary.  Say hello to the President for me... Maybe now you can change that carpet in your office, Teddy... So what was the deal you made with DeHaven?  Or was it the Devil?  Always get them confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear?  Effective immediately, all navy vessels can no longer be referred to as "she." BRAYS of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce, EXCUSING his way through the crowd, fixating on th bar, leading his DIAL-A-DATE winner by the hand. Conversations drift into earshot:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... women are child-bearers.  Life- givers.  Now we're going to make them killers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just don't have the upper-body strength...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How strong do you need to be to launch a rocket?  To push a button or pull a trigger? Royce can't get away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now. Just yards from the bar, a Pentagon E-RINGER snags Royce' elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Royce.  How's life across the river?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little slow, sir.  When's the Pentagon going to send me a good crisis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check my out-basket in the morning.  Say, do you know... The E-Ringer turns to make introductions -- but finds his CIRCLE OF FRIENDS embroiled in the topic du jour:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but men have trained as athletes for 5,000 years.  Women have been at it for, what, couple of decades?  Do we really know the limits of their strength?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or their endurance?  You know, 30 years ago, women marathoners were 90 minutes off the pace of the men. Now, the women's time is probably only 20 minutes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what do female soldiers really contribute?  I mean, why is this "G.I. Jane" there instead of a man? Eyes drift to Royce, inviting him into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to dial-a-date)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait right here.  I'll get the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading upstairs with an iceless rum.  Royce finds a calm and secluded place to get drunk in peace and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my word for it.  It's just not going to happen.  Not now, not anytime soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're guaranteeing that? Royce frowns:  He thought he was alone.  He tracks the voices to a forced-air vent beside the chaise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it on unorthodox but reliable authority that combat positions will remain off-limits.  Despite what's happening with our Babe in Boyland. Alarms go off in Royce's head.  He moves quickly to a railing, looks down. ROYCE'S POV:  Of two naval officers on the floor below. They stand beside a matching vent.  It's impossible to se faces from this angle -- but one man has a distinct bald spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, isn't that what these test cases are supposed to decide? (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless, of course, you're suggesting that "G.I. Jane" is on her way to becoming "Jane Doe"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is that we won't be integrating -- despite the rhetoric coming off Capitol Hill, despite what's happening in Coronado.  And you did not hear it from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what? A conspiratorial handshake.  The men split up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce flashes down the stairs.  Hitting main floor, he looks around and then bumps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.  Can we please dance now? Over her shoulder, Royce spies Bald Spot heading for the cloak room.  Royce commandeers the nearest J.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a dance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce bobs and weaves through the crowd, trying to keep sight of... Bald Spot.  Pushing through the exit doors. Only steps behind, Royce shoulders through the doors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And blasts outside, intending to shake some answers out o Bald Spot.  But here Royce finds... A dozen naval officers waiting for their cars.  All of them now wear caps. Royce tries to check faces of the quickly departing men. but it could have been anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-speed transport ("Seafox") is SLAMMING OVER SWELLS Lashed to one side is a rubber life boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crew Six!  Stand by!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flea!  'Cool!  O'Neil!  Cortez! Slutnik!  In that order!  Five- second intervals!  Let's go! England's crew lines up for cast-and-recover drills:  One by one, they speed-roll off the transport... ... and drop into the life boat.  After quickly stabilizing, they roll off the life boat... ... and disappear underwater like human bullets.  England is last to cast off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan resurfaces.  Treading water, she scans for... Seafox.  It makes a hard turn in the water and starts back.  The recovery rig -- a big flexible loop -- is lowered into position. Still hauling ass, Seafox picks up the trainees in revers order -- England, Slutnik, Cortez.  They each stab an arm through the passing loop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and vault back aboard, slick as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo-yah!  Better'n sex in a car crash! But now they're bearing down fast on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
