dialogues.text: Jordan.  She braces as best she can.  As SEAFOX THUNDERS past, she stabs for the loop... And snags it with her hand.  But only her hand. Hanging on grimly, Jordan drags face down in torrential water.  Her mouth gropes for clean air but can't find it. If she doesn't let go soon, she'll drown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the stern, the Chief spots Jordan bobbing up in the boat's wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next recovery!  Keep goin', keep goin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUGHING up water, Jordan watches Seafox speed on toward McCool and Flea.  They make textbook recoveries.  She's the only one who couldn't cut it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head hung, Jordan showers alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the Israelis... Jordan recoils.  Christ, how long has he been there?  Jus standing in the doorway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... they tried women in the 1967 War.  Female soldiers. With forced calm, Jordan squeaks off the water and finds towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to get dressed, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems the men couldn't get used to the sight of women blown open and their viscera hanging from tree limbs.  Israeli men would linger over wounded females -- often to the detriment of the mission, often endangering their own lives.  They don't use women anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, someone mentioned you received the Navy Cross.  May I ask what you got it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For pulling a 210-pound man out of a burning barrack in Saudi Arabia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  So when a man tries to rescue another man, he's a hero. But when he tries to rescue a woman, he's gone soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you have pulled that 210-pound man clear, lieutenant? She can't say yes.  She wants to but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Females in combat situations impact unit cohesion.  Men fight better without women around.  And that is an historical fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It also seems like a problem with the men's attitude, sir.  So maybe you should be sniffing around their shower room instead. She shoulders past.  The Chief gives her a few steps before dropping his bomb:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: England went out with a stress fracture.  That puts you in charge, lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off-balance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCool's that same rank.  We're both j.g.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were commissioned one month earlier, which makes you the senior officer. (passing her on his way out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember.  There are no bad crews -- only bad leaders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trainees are getting familiar with M-60 machine guns, firing SHORT BURST at downfield targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No operational experience, and now she's callin' the shots? Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose she'll wanna eat with us now... Jordan overhears them BITCHING.  She steps up to an open slot -- and proceeds to WAIL AWAY with her M-60, tracer rounds blazing.  Her target vaporized, she keeps WAILING madly, taking out Slutnik's target... then Cortez's... then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil... O'Neil... O'NEIL! Finally she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One burst, one body, O'Neil!  What the fuck you trying to do?  Spell your name? (to class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not infantry!  Your firepower is limited!  Excessive killing only risks compromise... Reloading, Jordan tosses a look at Slutnik and Cortez. Ain't nobody bitchin' now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.E.R.E. training coming up. Eating at a table with other women, Jordan turns to see Blondell setting down her tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take you away to San Clemente Island.  Half the guys quit when they come back.  Supposed to be just hell-and-a-half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you somethin', lieutenant? How come you're doing this?  I mean, we're kinda curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's "we"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some of the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking across the base:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if there's any single reason.  But my father was Navy. And he had this old-time recruiting poster in his den.  It showed a girl trying on a sailor's uniform while saying, "Gee, I wish I were a man! I'd join the Navy!"  Was maybe 10 years old when I first saw it, and even then it felt wrong.  Made me mad.  And I don't think a month has gone by that I haven't thought about that poster.  "Gee, I wish I were a man."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been accused of that wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman I saw you with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a friend.  We have friends, too, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But are there... I mean, how many...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than you'd guess.  It's just that we don't hold coffee klatches. If more then three of us get together at any one time, the guys think it's some kind of uprising. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds funny now, but it's really not.  We have to be careful.  The Navy still knows how to put on a witch-hunt. Reaching the quarterdeck, they scan a message board. Jordan finds a half-dozen phone slips for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying you for five days. Don't they give you messages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to find time to sleep, Royce.  Much less keep up with my phone life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard they making it on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan sighs and slumps against the phone kiosk.  Where t start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like there's men here, there's women here -- then there's men.  But hey, what'd I expect? INTERCUTTING Jordan and Royce:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not this.  I was doing the Pentagon scene few nights ago.  Got some fresh stuff -- about you.  You may be in a hostile camp.  I think someone may be taking steps to ensure that you crash and burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know?  How they're talking about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw an article...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk two blocks in Washington without hearing about "G.I. Jane."  You're all over the place, and whether you wanted it or not, the feminists are sizing you up for that poster. Jordan's face sours with an errant thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big symbols make big targets, Jordan.  I think someone's gunning for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Royce, I got enough heat on me without you turning up the jets, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only trying to warn you in case --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me warm you:  I'm going though with this.  The more everybody fucks with me, fucks with my head, the more it just makes me want to finish.  So don't expect me back crying in your arms any time soon, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I want, Jordan.  I mean... it is and it isn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still can't make up your mind, huh? Gotta go, Royce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan.  You watch your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I'll join the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HELO WARMS UP on its pad. Crew Six approaches, garbed in black wetsuits, loaded dow with weapons and rucksacks.  Jordan is at the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helo is airborne.  Sitting on rucksacks, trainees slather their faces with green camouflage paint.  Over th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infiltrate... establish your hide- site... record any movement of troops, vehicles, patrols -- any activity inside your scan.  If you are compromised, you have two options!  Newberry! Newberry is the new sixth man.  He's young enough to stil have a hyperactive Adam's apple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evasive maneuvers or radio for emergency extraction, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are extracting, be damn sure to follow procedures you have learned in your classroom training! A helo cannot extract you from a wooded area!  You must bring it down in a clearing!  What's the minimum clearance for an MH-60 Black Hawk, McCool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 feet, six inches, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be penalized for early extraction, but you will be penalized more for capture -- trust me, far more!  Survival!  Evasion! Rescue!  Evacuation!  Welcome to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helo swoops low over the water, moon silhouetting. Black figures helo-cast into the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last out, Jordan is poised to follow when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant!  Don't back down! Jordan looks back.  "What the hell does that mean?" Offering no elaboration, Pyro signals "GO!"  Jordan springs clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and knifes into black water. The HELO PATTERS away. An inky stillness overtakes the world. Jordan activates a red-light beacon, sweeps it around, revealing her position to... Her crew.  Five black faces regroup around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel right at home, McCool? They secure weapons atop their waterproof rucksacks. Jordan checks a heat-bearing compass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding direction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South-southeast.  And I don't want to hear another word till we're underground. Pushing rucksacks ahead of them, they start swimming towards... A moonlit shoreline.  Half-mile ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan's crew reaches shallow water.  They deflate their vests and rucksacks.  Jordan trades her face mask for night-vision goggles. NIGHT-VISION POV:  Sweeping the rocks.  Nothing at first. Then two "hostiles" appear, patrolling the rocks. Jordan motions "down."  Six faces sink from sight. NIGHT-VISION/UNDERWATER POV:  Of the "hostile" patrol moving on. They resurface.  On Jordan's cue, the crew sheds flippers and begins scaling rocks.  They've made landfall.

dialogues.speaker: SAN CLEMENTE ISLAND
dialogues.text: MONTAGE:  Racing the coming sun, Jordan's crew builds their hide-site... digging feverishly... filling sand bags... telescoping open a roof pole, fanning out spars.. laying canvas roof panels into place... camouflaging the panels... sprinkling sanitizing powder around the perimeter to ward off animals.  INTERCUT WITH... A snake slithering across the ground.  As it nears the hide-site... A knife whacks its head off. Slutnik picks up the carcass, kicks dirt over the severed head.  No trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the island, awash in morning light.  Woodland lie distant.  A road is the only man-made feature -- unti in FOREGROUND, we find a spotting scope poking from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOPE POV:  Of the road.  Fast-attack vehicles approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering into scope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got two FAVs moving south.  I make... four banditos aboard, carrying... H-60 machine guns... Jordan REPEATS THE INFO into a digital tape-recorder, add the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newberry, get a photo.  South?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering my scan now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear. SCOPE POV:  Of the FAVs disappearing down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAVs clear. Everyone relaxes -- as much as six people can in a hole five feet-wide.  McCool opens up MREs (Meals Ready to Eat Slutnik guts his snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind?  I'm trying to eat here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. Cortez finishes pissing into a tin pot.  He transfers the waste to a zip-lock baggy, offers the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone? He looks at Jordan.  She eyes the pot, tempted and nettle at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna evacuate 'cuz someone came down with uric poisoning, el- tee. Abruptly Jordan unzips, drops her pants, sticks the pot under her.  It raises eyebrows:  It's a far cry from when she was covering up in cold water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't even bitch about the seat, did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE VIEW:  As a lone figure appears on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the... Got an unknown here. 100 yards north-northeast. They pile up at McCool's scope.  Jordan bulls her way through. SCOPE POV:  It's a women.  Dressed in civilian clothes, she collects firewood.  And she's coming this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She part of the training?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She?"  There's another one? McCool takes a second look. SCOPE POV:  Of the women drawing closer... closer... and finally looking dead-bang at us.  She does an about-face and walks away.  Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Think we're had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't gonna shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only blanks.  Lemme do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Ain't your call, man. He looks to Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pri One is to protect the mission. If she represents a real threat, we have to do it. Pleased, Cortez slips his rifle under a roof panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McCool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But did she see us?  Do you know for a fact that we are compromised? McCool doesn't.  Not for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If not, firing will only give away our position to hostiles in the area.  Now how smart is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mighta been civilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got regular peeps on this island, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The asphalt road shimmers with midday heat.  Suddenly a TROOP CARRIER ROARS over a rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOPE POV:  Of the troop carrier braking hard.  "Hostiles spill out the rear -- and fan out all around us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at scope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banditos on the east perimeter!  150 yards!  Shit, she was part of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the word, el-tee?  We're about one minute from a major take- down here. HOLD on Jordan, heart skipping.  Did she really make the wrong call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, fire-and-evade maneuvers. Drop everything but weapons and the PRC radio -- we're gonna be high speed, low drag all the way to the link-up site.  Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Now she wants to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come out of the hide-site like atomic locusts, splintering into three groups and laying down SUPPRESSIVE FIRE as they blitz for... The woodlands. "Hostiles" FIRE and pursue. Flea is running flat out when the ground vanishes beneath him.  He goes down like a doped race horse.  Suddenly exposed, another crew scrambles into daylight:  Flea ran right over their hide-site. Slutnik yanks Flea out, gets him back on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathing like asthmatics, Jordan's crew regroups at the link-up site just inside the woods.  Flea comes in hobbling.  Badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't workin' right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's our go-to-shit plan, O'Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't even workin' wrong! A beat as Jordan deliberates.  She doesn't want to go out like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really don't wanna be captured, el- tee.  Heard some bad things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. (snatching the radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher-Basher, this is Ground Crew Six requesting emergency extraction. Stand by for a PRC fix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a helo pirouettes in midair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan's crew lopes through the woods, searching for a place to bring the helo down.  Right on their heels... ARTILLERY SIMULATORS THUMP-THUMP-THUMP, illumination GRENADES POP and flare.  This may not be war, but it'll d until the real thing comes along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT'S POV:  Buzzing treetops, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the run:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 feet, six inches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lookin', I'm lookin'! Finally they break into a clearing.  Is it big enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't care)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke it! Jordan chucks a smoke grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT'S POV:  Yellow smoke rises from the woods.  We swoo toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whirling smoke, the helo descends.  Jordan's crew breaks early, trying to get there the instant it touches down. But before they can... An FAV crashes through the underbrush, M-60s BARKING in the helo's direction.  The helo bounds away. Jordan's crew tries to retreat -- but a second FAV cuts them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT'S POV:  Of the action below, growing smaller and smaller:  Jordan's crew.  Surrounded.  Laying down weapons.  Captured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JORDAN'S POV:  Brush slapping her face. Crew Six is being hauled through the woods, hands tied back, boots around their necks, pulled along by... The captors.  We assume they're instructors in camouflage paint -- but we're moving so fast it's impossible to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A P.O.W. camp, disturbingly authentic.  A dozen trainees are already here, held in pens of bamboo and barbed-wire. Flea, McCool, Slutnik, Cortez, Newberry -- all five get tossed into a pen.  Jordan is pulled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you... HEY!  Where are you taking her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan is thrown to the ground.  Her eyes go wide when sh sees a row of steel boxes nearby.  They're scarcely large then coffins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands push Jordan inside the box.  She has to curl up fetally just to fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, HOW LONG? The LID BANGS closed.  A LOCK RATCHETS, FOOTSTEPS RETREAT Daylight sheets in through ventilation slats. When her eyes adjust, Jordan finds markings on the lid an walls.  Scratchings made with a nail.  The memoirs of previous tenants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't know how much I can take"... "A little taste of death"... "Save the nail"... (then the real kick- in-the-teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's been three days now"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As "hostiles" pull Flea out of the pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANGING wakes Jordan.  Are they coming for her?  But FOOTSTEPS LEAVE.  A GROAN from the adjacent box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I had an apartment about this size once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wick.  They got your crew, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intagliata was out chasing breakfast.  They found his tracks. Well, shit. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really came back for more?  Of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was sittin' behind a desk in Washington, it made sense, somehow. Blame it on my big brother.  He was Spec-Recon.  And the stories he used to tell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got a good one, Wick... Anything to get her mind off this box.  Out of this box. Now INTERCUT Jordan and Wickwire, lying like fraternal twins in their wombs of steel:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time he was doing a rekkie of the Libyan coastline.  This is, like, right before we bombed Khadaffi into the past tense.  So his crew does a nighttime infil, maps all the big artillery placements and stuff, then turns around to get the hell gone.  But between them and the water are five Libyan guards, all armed to the nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had to kill 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, they were dead-ass asleep.  But on every guard's chest,they left one Marlboro cigarette.  Just a little calling card to say they'd been there -- and could come back any time they wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the shit you gotta go through? To get from here to there?  Brother said it was worth it.  Worth the training... worth the divorce... worth anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anybody, Wick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.  You? It hurts to think about it.  The Potomac.  The gunkhole harbor.  Royce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you make it last time, Wick? How'd you get through this part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jarred)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep talkin', Wick.  Just keep talkin' to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce stops for a newspaper.  As he pays, something else catches his eye.  He picks up... A "People" magazine.  The grainy image of "G.I. Jane" fills the cover.  A photo inset, much clearer, shows a beaming DeHaven.  "BEHIND EVERY GREAT WOMAN..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suitable for framing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got time for a brain-pick? Reading as he walks, a former CIA spook looks up to find Royce in lockstep.  It surprises him:  Not many people here talk to him -- unless they're in trouble.  THE SPOOK is physically unremarkable except for a face that would b right at home on Easter Island:  This is a man who's seen most of the world's ills -- and forgotten none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil, Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you two were file-closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Thought you knew I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce and the Spook enter.  The vault-like door closes emphatically.  Ensuring their privacy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer -- no transcription, no com-link, no data-link.  In fact... shut-down sequence 0-Niner-0-8, mark. All around, screens go blank, phone lights extinguish. They sit at the conference table.  No Computer.  No files Just two guys doing headwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  So who stands to gain if Jordan flames out in a big way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E-Ringers?  Full integration is gonna cost the services billions at the worst possible time -- when Congress is already swinging the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congress cuts, military bleeds.  But Pentagon's a big place.  Let's narrow the sights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navy?  They've made it clear they don't want to pull missiles out of subs to make room for women's heads.  What's it gonna cost to make a fleet of Trident's co-ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabotage born of economics? Wouldn't be a first.  But is Hayes really going to start his watch with such a public failure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly.  Just to spite DeHaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.  Let's aim higher. Royce blinks.  "What's higher?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White House.  If Jordan wins, DeHaven wins in spades.  Why?  Well, it's been said that the only man the President fears -- ain't no man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first female President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't for a second think she didn't leak this story.  "G.I. Jane" gives DeHaven a symbol that taps into the biggest constituency of them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were the President, wouldn't that put a little piss in your shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Seems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't about some little soldier girl sloggin' her way through commando school.  The implications go way beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I don't want to see her take a fall.  She thinks I do, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it this file is still open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaping his words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even tough I don't talk to her every day -- I still talk to her every day.  Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so now work it from the other end.  Think about California -- and how things might be handled there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... (scoffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, someone on base?  A "mole"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you get for brain- picking an old CIA spook.  but if I needed to control the outcome of this test case, that's how I'd do it.  A man-in-place.  Makes everything very controllable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JORDAN'S POV:  The box opening.  Daylight assaulting us, blowing out our eyes.  Disembodied hands pulling us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legs hobbled, uniform soiled, Jordan is led past a row of huts.  She looks like she got hit by a train -- and got back up. JORDAN'S POV:  Vision still blown out.  But inside the pen, we make out 40 trainees now.  One guy wrings out a sock and drinks from it. Jordan moves past huts.  VOLATILE VOICES spill out as trainees get interrogated. JORDAN'S POV:  Outside one hut, we see Flea.  At least we think it's him:  Strapped face-down to a table, sobbing quietly, he wears a slinky dress and whore's makeup.  The broke him -- and it's an ugly, ugly sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your father's name? Jordan seated.  Prowling the hut is her interrogator.  He tormentor.  Her chaperon through Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple question, lieutenant.  No reason not to answer.  What is your father's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any brothers?  Sisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, Jane, and Spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?  What's your favorite food?  We'll try to get it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green Eggs and Ham.  You're not going to get anywhere.  You might as well put me in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in the cage, O'Neil.  Right here, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I be afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right down to your worthless womb, and I'll tell you why.  This is my island.  My world.  And here I can get away with shit that would get me arrested anywhere else in the world. Take another scan of my little joy- boy outside.  If I can do that to a Navy Seal, what's gonna happen to you?  Huh? It makes Jordan think -- and yes, it makes her afraid. Continuing the psychological strip-search:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you shoot the woman, O'Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't deemed a threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She led us right to you.  That's no threat? Jordan rubs her head.  So long ago.  How did the call com down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you have shot if it was a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Yes.  I mean, depends on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others already told me, O'Neil. They wanted to shoot, but you wouldn't let them.  Because you went soft on another women --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what your crew said.  Are they lying?  Or are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're the liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the one who got five good men thrown in a bamboo cage.  You wear the bars, you made the call, and you got your whole crew --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't know we were compromised. Firing would only've given away our position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we should go easy on women, O'Neil? She stares a beat, knowing it's a loaded question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad we agree. With stunning ferocity, he grabs her by the neck, pushes her out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and throws her onto a table. In the pens, all faces turn to watch.  Even instructors stop what they're doing as... The Chief pushes Jordan's head down and jams up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you know you'd be raped if you were captured?  Didn't you even think about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Just like your men do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we oughtta practice it, just so you know what to expect. He flips her over, rips off her belt, starts tearing open her pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I practice bleeding, too, sir?  Would that make me a better soldier? He covers her mouth -- her whole face -- with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of you can stop this!  Just give me the location of one more hide- site, and it ends right here! In the pen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's trippin' out here... The Chief jerks Jordan up, whirls her around like a dead dance partner, slams her face-first into the pen to give the guys a good look at what's happening to that pretty face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three crews are still on this island somewhere.  Who knows where? The men trade itchy looks.  Some do know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, don't do it... The Chief throws her down like garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna tell me?  Who's gonna be chivalrous and stop this abuse? What, you want to see her get mauled?  Is that it? The men shift anxiously.  Should they talk?  Behind the Chief, Jordan staggers to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him shi -- The Chief whirls, decks her a crescent-kick.  Instructors lurch forward instinctively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving them back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine! (squatting beside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I put you down, O'Neil, take the hint and stay down. She licks her bloody teeth -- and considers kicking his balls into his brainpan.  Instead she makes a move to get up.  He grinds her back down with a crowbar forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for her ears only)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am saving your life, O'Neil.  You may not know it, but I do.  You're an inferior soldier, a bad officer, and I don't want you learning that inconvenient truth when you're stuck in a muddy bomb crater behind enemy lines and don't know how the fuck to get out.  You get out now, O'Neil. Seek life elsewhere.  And if you can't do it in front of me, do it behind my back. Pinning her down with just his eyes, he rises -- and starts away. Behind him, Jordan struggles to rise. An ANXIOUS MURMUR races through the men:  They don't want to see this.  They don't want to see her crucified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down... stay down... Hearing, the Chief turns back to see... Jordan wobbling to her feet. Eye-lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you and the boat you rode in on.  Sir. TIGHT on the faces of her crewmates -- Slutnik, Cortez, McCool.  In their eyes, a new respect.  The Chief see it. Instructors see it.  Everyone does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to instructors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done here. Beaten, he walks right out of camp. Wordless, instructors open the pens, unlock the boxes. Wickwire rises like a vampire in daylight.  But this time he made it. A medic tries to help Jordan, but she pushes him away, walking drunkenly for... Flea.  She begins wiping the makeup from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make you a deal, Flea.  Never tell me how I look -- and I'll never tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief chucks gear onto a transport boat.  FOOTSTEPS approach.  He knows it's Pyro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think she'd be raped if she were captured?  You don't think the threat of rape would be used to leverage the men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke a dozen training rules back there -- before I lost count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it.  Just because they pay me like a baby-sitter doesn't mean I'm gonna be one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a trainee, just like the others.  Why are you coming down so hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an officer.  There's a higher standard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a women, and that's why you're ridin' her bareback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is.  And I'm gonna stay on her until everyone realizes this is not some bullshit equal-rights thing, that real lives are gonna be lost.  Maybe mine, maybe yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I oughtta report you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you probably would -- if you didn't know I was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a limo moves -- heads for the Capitol building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeHaven snags a BUZZING PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made it through S.E.R.E. training.  Got a call this morning from --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that.  The White House just announced that it was sponsoring legislation that would, in one stroke, void all remaining elements of the 1948 Combat Exclusion Laws. The phone suddenly weights a ton, DeHaven dumps it on the seat beside her.  HOLD on her disbelieving face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You there?  Senator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-carrying a report, Flag Officer #1 hurries down a corridor, pushes through a door.  HOLD on the door marker "Secretary of the Navy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without telling us they do this? With absolutely no lead time? At his desk, Hayes scans the report with a deepening frown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hayes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Secretary, if this bill passes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget our three-year plan.  They're rushing the cadence.  We'll be forced to reorganize the Navy from top to bottom -- overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is the President trying to do?  Steal DeHaven's thunder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's more important, sir, to decide what we're going to do -- since it's apparent this issue is not going away quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "G.I. Jane."  And which one of you told me she wouldn't last a week? Huh? The flags squirm.  Shaking his head, Hayes moves to a window that offers a stunning view of Arlington National Cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 years in the Pentagon, I finally rate an office with a window -- and it looks out over the world's largest graveyard.  Think it's a sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell.  It reflects the moon.  TILT DOWN to reveal a new batch of helmets -- the casualties of S.E.R.E.  A graveyard of its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan exits with purchases.  Her face is still bruised from S.E.R.E.  With a minute to kill, she peruses a bulletin board casually.  But a RAISED VOICE leads her eyes to... Wickwire.  At a phone kiosk, he hangs up emphatically.  H looks flustered when he spots Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, didn't mean to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  Just an ex-girlfriend. And know I remember why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First big night of liberty and no date?  You're pathetic, Wickwire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll just head over to McP's with the others, have a drink or four.  Don't wanna come, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching bruises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go out.  Not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for lying.  But you're the class officer, Wick, and it'd just be weird if we hook up.  Besides... Catching up, Blondell exits the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Forgot I needed oregano and... She sees Wickwire.  An awkward beat for them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, uh, know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going over to her place to make salad and pasta.  Just, you know, nothing special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Well... thought I'd ask. Jordan and Blondell head for the parking lot.  HOLD on Wickwire, looking after them.  Thinking it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charts are being passed around the room.  Every trainee takes one, including Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... underwater detonation devices employ mechanical timers, and as such, they are subject to variances due to water temperature.  That's why when clearing mines, we always use two timers.  The charts now being passed out contain calculations you must memorize before... A MILITARY COP fills the classroom doorway.  Frowning, Johns joins the cop for a private discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wanted at the C.O.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan enters.  The yeoman's desk is unattended.  Noticin the X.O.'s door open, Jordan peers inside to find... Blondell.  She looks scared out of her mind.  Before she and Jordan can speak, the yeoman materializes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, lieutenant.  They're expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See me, sir? The C.O. and X.O. are both here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know of any delicate way to say this, lieutenant, so I won't try.  Claims have been made that you have engaged in fraternization -- of the same-sex variety.  Specifically, that you were... (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... seen leaving the apartment of another female officer at such a time and in such a manner as to suggest conduct unbecoming."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat,laughing in relief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if someone is suggesting that I'm a lesbian, they're wrong. The C.O.'s face remains grim.  He isn't relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're very wrong.  And I'd like to know where you got this information. On the C.O.'s nod, the X.O. opens an adjoining office. Wickwire enters.  He's stiff as a groom on a wedding cake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, O'Neil.  But as class officer, it's my obligation to report all violations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.  You've got no proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from report)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were seen leaving Ensign Blondell's apartment at approximately 0-200, whereupon physical affections were exchanged in public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hugged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In addition, you have been seen frequenting the base exchange, the mess hall, the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the men didn't want me eating with them.  Jesus Christ, let's get this right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.  Everybody. (to Wickwire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rejoin your class, lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (only to Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I didn't have to do this, Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissed, lieutenant. Wickwire exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I just want you to know that this is either a gross mistake -- or someone's vindictive bullshit. In no way did anything happen between Ensign Blondell and myself. We're just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying the charges have no validity whatsoever? Jordan opens her mouth to confirm -- and hesitates, realizing where this might be headed.  What the collatera damage might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying, we're just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find this as distasteful as you, lieutenant.  But if it's on my desk, it's on my shoulders.  There's going to be an inquiry -- it will not be quick and it will definitely not be pretty.  You should prepare yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, please... if there's any way to do this without dragging everyone through the mud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how, O'Neil.  Dismissed. Jordan moves to the door.  Again she makes eye-contact with Blondell.  Now we understand why she's so scared: There's a witch-hunt brewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.  If tomorrow... I was not under your command... would the inquiry still go forward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you have the discretion to end it right then and there? She's offering her own head on a silver platter -- and th C.O. actually hesitates before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCool and Flea exit a classroom with other trainees. They spot Jordan approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'd he want?  O'Neil? She passes them robotically.  Flea realizes where she's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... no, no, no, no... They lurch after her, grabbing her, stepping in her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand fast! McCool and Flea jerk to a stop:  The Chief has emerged from the instructor's office.  Helpless, they watch as... Jordan mounts the stairs to the bell... takes up the baton... and HITS THE BELL like a tyko drummer. RING ONE:  On the pained faces of her crewmates. RING TWO:  On the Chief.  Taking no joy in it.  Just accepting it as inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING THREE:  On Wickwire as he walks across the base.  Hi regrets are obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice floes are gone.  The river banks are budding green.  Soon CAMERA FINDS a power boat making its way upriver.  A lone figure sits on the prow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jordan.  Dressed in civvies, gunnysack between her legs, she's back in Virginia with nothing more than what she left with.  Around a river bend appears... The gunkhole harbor.  Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat docks.  Jordan springs clear, waves a worn-out thanks, starts up the dock.  But now she comes to a stop, seeing... Royce.  Stepping out of the house. EXTREMELY WIDE:  River shimmering behind them, they meet on the dock.  A charged stand-off:  Where do they pick up Can they pick up?  Then Jordan drops her gunnysack and steps into his wide-spread arms.  Royce wraps her up as i to never let go. For the first time in this whole ordeal, Jordan begins crying, sobbing uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in her ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to kill them... I want to kill the guys who made you cry like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour later.  Sharing a quiet moment, Jordan and Royce cradle tea mugs while sitting on the rear porch that overlooks the Potomac and a fiery sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wanted was an honest chance. And If I couldn't get it, I couldn't stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this class officer... "Wickwire."  You think he was just trying to get even?  Striking back for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Though it didn't seem like he was getting any satisfaction out of it.  Almost like... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say he was class officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost like someone put him up to it.  Okay, who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shortage of suspects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief?  Or maybe even Turrentine?  Your C.O.? She looks at him sidelong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royce.  Tell me you didn't keep a file on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on multiple files being pulled out of a briefcase. One contains clippings -- "G.I. Jane" photos, editorials, political cartoons.  Another holds records of Coronado personnel -- Jordan's crewmates, instructors, the base brass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody was yankin' your stings, Jordan -- maybe from 3,000 miles away.  I wanted to know who.  I still do. She shakes her head, resisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jordan.  Do the headwork with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done with, Royce.  Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone screwed you over like this, left unanswered charges hanging over your head, and you're not gonna fight back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of fighting back.  I just wanted to come home and be safe and have you here and the river there and just forget the rest of the world, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, before you crawl off to die, Jordan, give me five minutes of good headwork. Agitated, she walks away.  B.G., a PHONE RINGS until the machine picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling a file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "John James Urgayle."  The Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instructors typically pull three year assignments.  This guy's in and out in one year -- your year.  That sound right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like an amazing coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or like maybe he was baby sitting a problem child for the Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, pardon me if I do.  Now who else?  Who could've leveraged a class officer like that?  C'mon, Jordan, keep your head in the game. UNDER DIALOG, we hear some of the INCOMING CALL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just got word today.  The Senator wants you to know that she's disturbed by the matter, and she'll be looking into it carefully to make sure you were treated fairly.  If you need to reach us, we're here in Washington, 202-224-3121. A HANG-UP.  Something stirs in Jordan's memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In Washington..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wickwire said he was dry-docked in Washington between stints at Coronado... We can see her mind gathering speed.  Royce switches file quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wickwire, Thomas Dane"... Second run at Coronado... and correct, they had him stashed in the "Appropriation Liaison Office," whatever that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't crap out of Spec-Recon and get another shot without dispensation from someone up in flag country. (a revelation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a Sea Daddy somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd sure like to know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answering a PHONE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Administration, Ensign Blondell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's... (brightening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieuten --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or rank.  But can you do me a favor and pull a transfer order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but... You didn't have to do what you did.  Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wickwire, Thomas Dane."  See what you can find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: File in hand, Blondell returns to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who signed as his "sponsoring officer"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... don't see it.  There's no signature.  But hang on -- there's a note to "See Addendum."  Checking... She finds a crisp sheet of stationary, out of place among the smeared government forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you find, Kathy? CLOSE on the stationary.  It bears an image of the Capito dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Capitol dome.  A flag is being raised over the Senate Wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car parks at barricades.  Jordan and Royce emerge, both in uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even dream about leaving that vehicle there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Government car -- tow it if you want.  Just point us to DeHaven's office first. Not waiting for directions, Jordan takes the Capitol step two at a time.  We've seen this look on her face before - and last time, she nearly knocked the grinder bell into orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Royce move quickly down a corridor, eyes hunting, passing CAPITOL GUIDES and their tourists.  Soon they find... DeHaven's office.  A Navy captain exits with paperwork. Hasty salutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt'n.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander. The captain moves on.  Royce holds in the doorway a beat, memory nagging him.  Again he looks at... The captain.  He has a distinct bald spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get started here.  I'll catch up. Picking up where he left off a few weeks ago, Royce follows Bald Spot around a corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... down a private staircase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and through a door marked "Naval Appropriation Liaiso Office."  It's not 30 seconds from DeHaven's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant j.g. O'Neil. In a side office, DeHaven's aide overhears.  He rises quickly and enters the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. O'Neil.  Yes, of course.  I'm Douglas Champeau.  Unfortunately, the Senator is in chamber right now. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What chamber?  Which way is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, she's on the floor of the Senate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She really can't be disturbed.  But if you care to wait, I'll find you an office with a phone.  It might be several hours, but -- A TOURIST pokes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, but I'm here to pick up gallery tickets?  Are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the secretary, please. Over the aide's shoulder, Jordan watches as... The tourist claims tickets.  HOLD on the bureau near the secretary's desk where the tickets are stored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the chamber floor, SENATORS mull about, consulting aides, polling party mates.  PAGES place microphones and fill the ceremonial snuff boxes, readying the room for session.  Among the activity, we find... DeHaven.  Caucusing with another Democrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator DeHaven... DeHaven looks behind her.  Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeHaven... Now she looks up to behold... Jordan standing in the gallery.  Staring down on DeHaven as she is, it's hard to read anything into her expression but open disdain. Drawn by Jordan's voice, a CAPITOL GUARD hurries down the gallery steps.  Royce runs interference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can talk here or we can talk outside, Senator.  You tell me. On the floor, half the U.S. Senate stops what it's doing and looks up. In the gallery, the guard is thrown off-balance by the naval uniforms:  Do Royce and Jordan belong here or not? Confused, he looks for guidance from... DeHaven.  She notes C-SPAN cameras swinging Jordan's way. Summoning a page:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cloak room.  I'll meet her there. Just her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towering doors swing open.  DeHaven appears, face pleasan but harried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan.  I always hoped we'd get together -- though just now I'm gearing up for a child-care vote that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Thomas Wickwire. About to hug Jordan, DeHaven stops awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should.  You nominated him for Spec-Recon just three days after you nominated me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan.  Might we do this over lunch tomorrow?  I do very much want to talk, but now is scarcely --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you set me up?  Did you set me up just to see me fail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. DeHaven glances back at the doors to the Senate chamber - the open doors.  Walking Jordan a few steps away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wickwire was there to help.  To be my eyes on the inside, to make sure you were getting a fair shot.  At least that was the intent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should probably ask him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have to ask again, Senator, I'll be asking in front of cameras. It's a threat DeHaven doesn't appreciate.  The Senate DOORKEEPER appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Senator?  Your esteemed colleagues are requesting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two seconds, Walter. (answering Jordan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1981, the Supreme Court was asked to rule on the issue of women in combat positions.  The Court cited the 1948 Combat Exclusion Laws as a legal foundation for keeping women ineligible.  That decision held for all these years -- until the White House, 10 days ago, moved to have the Exclusion Laws voided. To demolish that legal foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  Isn't the President jumping on your bandwagon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he did was light the bandwagon on fire.  Because he knows what I know -- that American families are not prepared to put their daughters in harm's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In face, I do:  Roper, Harris, Gallop -- they all come back the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?  That a women's life is more valuable than a man's? That a women's death hurts a family more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying it's not going to happen. Not when the President is set to turn this into a third-rail issue should I choose to ever campaign against him.  He will fry me six ways to Sunday for sending daughters and young mothers off to war -- and, quite possibly, for bringing them back in body bags. Jordan shakes her head in disbelief.  She has met the enemy -- and she is us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were never going to let women serve in combat.  You always had a safety net.  Or thought you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan.  I don't expect you to fully understand this -- but sometimes there's more to be gained from the fight than the victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the rhetoric gets you headlines. But the reality gets you in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reality is this:  We send far too many men off to war.  I don't need to compound the problem with women. (off Jordan's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you honestly tell me you wanted that life?  Squat-pissing in some third-world jungle with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted the choice.  The chance to prove myself, my skills, my work, me.  That's how it should've been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Senator, once again I must --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold the goddamn clock, Walter. Not happy about it, the doorkeeper reaches into an alcove grabs a broom he keeps around for just these occasions. He enters the chamber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and moves behind the rostrum.  Holding the broom by the bristles, the doorkeeper stands on tip-toes... And uses the broom handle to turn back the Senate clock b three minutes. Senators GROAN.  It's an old trick played by senior members -- and they all hate it when it happens to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once promised you a fast ticket, Jordan, and I always meant to make good on that.  Come work for me.  I can always use a hard-charger on my team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise Wickwire a fast ticket, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had no direct communication with him since this whole thing began.  And that's quite verifiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll think about my offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I wonder what the SecNav would think about it.  If I spoke with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I spoke with Mr. Hayes this morning myself -- and told him the deal was off.  No more test cases. He was only too happy to oblige. (dangerously low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play politics with me, little darlin'.  You'd be up way past your bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Senator, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you in a few days. She flashes a winning smile and turns away.  As the chamber doors start to close behind her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I wonder what the President would think. The last image we have of DeHaven is her whirling back, startled.  The DOORS BOOM CLOSED in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a window, we see the C.O. with a phone pressed to his ear.  He stands at attention even though wearing a bathrobe.  Half-audible through the glass:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.  No, I'm not saying it would be impossible, sir, just... Yes sir.  No sir.  Yes sir.  I can appreciate that, sir.  Good night, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C.O. hangs up and looks to Jordan, heretofore unseen. She waits anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you had to go over my head, lieutenant, that's the way to do it.  Christ, nothin' like a 0-200 call from the Commander and Chief to get the bowels movin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?  What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically -- he asked me if I could unring a bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on the helmet graveyard.  Hands enter FRAME to reclaim one helmet in particular.  TILT UP on Jordan, back in the grinder, back in Navy greens. The Spec-Recon class is here.  Crewmates gawk like stone idiots as Jordan takes her old place in the line-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of you here understands better than anyone what this is all about. Someone who has engaged in conduct unbecoming.  Someone who knows, I would hope, what he must now do. CLOSE on Wickwire.  Feeling the heat.  Wondering if they really know who it is.  Now the C.O. parks himself right in Wickwire's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And unless that someone takes the honorable way out in the next 10 seconds -- I will make certain he faces action under the Uniform Code of Military Justice. Wickwire breaks rank and heads for the bell.  He slows when reaching Jordan, considering an apology he knows would be inadequate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just walk away and never stop. He does.  As Wickwire RINGS OUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems we have an opening for class officer.  Any nominations? Eyes swing to Jordan.  Way ahead of them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those in favor? A CHORUS OF AYES.  Jordan puddles up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Urgayle, turning it back over to you. On his way to the front, the Chief stops to check in with Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm trying to figure out if you're stupid, unlucky, gluttonous -- or some new alloy of all three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, too, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, O'Neil.  So you've impressed all the others.  Now try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun is an orange ball balanced on the Coronad Bridge.  In silhouette, pelicans circle, some dive-bombin into the bay below.  Suddenly a HELO HOWLS across the sun scattering the birds as it heads off-shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (setting watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four... three... two... one... hack! Flea, McCool, Slutnik, Cortez, Newberry, Jordan.  Inside the airborne helo, they synchronize their dive watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final assignment!  Each crew will be dropped 12 miles out!  Between you and the shore is a network of mines and underwater obstacles!  You will clear the obstacles, you will tag the mines with your crew number! You have until 18-hundred to make landfall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the helo swoops down onto the ocean deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trainees double-check wet gear and survival vests.  O Jordan's nod, they push an inflatable life boat ("ILB") t the helo door.  It's rolled up into a rubber log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember!  The one thing you can count on in any mission is that anything mechanical will fail!  If you get stuck out here, do not call me, for you will no longer be in my class!  Try the Coast Guard! The HELO PILOT slows to five knots.  The Chief gives Jordan the go-ahead nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-second intervals!  Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ILB splashes down into the ocean.  Jordan's crew helo casts in after it. From the door of the circling helo, the Chief watches as... Jordan's crew swims to the ILB, bobbing in the swells. Flea turns a handle on the CO2 tank meant to inflate the boat.  Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon... Cortez tries to help.  The handle spins in his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tank's not gonna cut it, el- tee.  Handle's stripped. Jordan looks skyward.  100 feet overhead, the Chief gives her a parting salute as the helo lifts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wonder how that happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez, see if you can dig out the tools without losing the rest of out gear.  Try a wrench on that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helo turns into the morning sun.  PILOT and CO-PILOT drop visors. PILOT'S POV:  Of dots in the sun.  What the hell are try? SMACK!  Something hits the windscreen, splattering red an brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking pelicans!  Hang on! He starts to bank clear -- but not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More birds pepper-shot the helo:  One SHREDS through the main rotor, another through the tail rotor.  Another bird gets sucked right into... The main turbine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHARP BANG... a WICKED SHIMMY... and now they whole hel loses power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy... LET'S GYRATE! As the pilot wrestles controls, the co-pilot rigs for auto-gyration.  But the bank they started is working against them:  The helo is coming down badly, circling like a huge steel feather. Braced, the Chief looks out the side door -- and sees ocean rushing up at him.  Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the shit is... Jordan whirls.  She's just in time to witness... The helo hitting the water.  In seconds it's gone. A stunned beat.  We never knew the ocean could be this quiet.  When the anesthetic of shock wears off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't suppose this is just part of...

dialogues.speaker: FLEA
dialogues.text: Mark it, mark it!  Cortez?  What the hell you waiting for? Cortez torques his wrench hard:  CO2 flows into the ILB, inflating it.  The crew scrambles aboard.  Jordan digs like a dog to find a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base, this is Crew Leader Six.  We have a downed helo 12 miles west- south west of base with three aboard.  Repeat, we have a downed helo with three aboard... Slutnik yanks a starter cord:  Their outboard MOTOR ROARS to life.  The boat does a donut in the water and blasts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ILB powers over swells.  Flea is perched on the bow, nose to the wind like a hunting dog.

dialogues.speaker: CUT IT
dialogues.text: Slutnik motors down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close as I can get, el-tee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flea, 'Cool, Cortez, Newman -- take your minis, hit the water.  Go, GO! They grab masks and mini-tanks and dive in like dolphins. Jordan snaps up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base, this is Crew Leader Six.  What is your E.T.A. on that rescue helo? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crew Leader, we have a Medevac rerouting from Long Beach, but no other helos prepped at this time. Seafox One and Two are launching now.  Over. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base, don't think you copied me.  We are 12 miles out.  Seafox tops out at 30 knots, which makes it a no- show for 18 minutes.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You copied right, Crew Leader. We're looking for options ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call the Coast Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your hole, Slutnik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCool surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visibility drops dead at 40 feet. If they're deeper than that... The others surface and swim in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's comin' outta that crash, el-tee.  Nobody. A grim beat -- and then A CRACKLE on the radio.  With a voice seemingly from the far side of the moon:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base, this is Basher One.  I've got a small problem here.  Do you copy? Jaws drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher One, this is O'Neil.  We are barely reading you.  What is your situation?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: 50 feet down, the helo lies canted on a reef shelf.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Wedged into a tortured maze of hydraulics and equipment, we find the Chief, operating out of an air-pocket near th windscreen.  The pilot is dead, impaled on his cyclic stick, head submerged.  The co-pilot is still alive, barely.  The Chief struggles to keep the man's head up as he keys a survival radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got one other heartbeat here, looks touch and go.  I've got a questionable leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Managed to activate the ELB.  If you just radio base and let them know, they'll fix on that.  Oh, and make sure they send a helo with a winch -- door's blocked by a reef.  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, sir -- rescue team won't be here for 15 minutes.  What's your air situation?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say again?  How many micks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Chief sizes up his air pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That... may not be adequate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could just fix on him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beacon's a no-go for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief -- did I see a flare box aboard?  And can you get at it? Over.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Chief props up the co-pilot's head.  Gulps air.  Duck underwater to grope through wreckage.  Only now do we see that "questionable leg" he was talking about:  It's snapped at mid-calf, blood rivering out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us where you are, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Again the Chief goes below water.  He finds a small breac in the fuselage... sticks the flare launcher through... and pulls the trigger. With a MAGNESIUM FLASH, the flare launches...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: ... streaks toward the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and arcs into daylight 50 yards behind the ILB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six o'clock!  Marking, marking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted you, Chief.  Pri One is to slip you some air, so we're coming down with a tank -- just something until the A-team shows.  Over. An ominous beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil... there's no air in your main tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? They scramble to check their main dive tanks.  Even through the gauges show full, they're dead empty.  All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mission wasn't about tagging mines.  It was to see how you coped with mechanical failures.  Pretty fuckin' ironic, huh? He laughs.  It's the bleakest laugh imaginable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's circlin' the drain, el-tee. Jordan surveys the equipment they do have aboard -- the stuff she can count on.  Mental turbos kicking in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we got two full mini-tanks, three minutes each.  'Cool?  How much air in yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe half.  Not even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab an oar, find a way to weight it down, we're gonna need it.  Cortez, help him.  Flea?  You take one of the two full minis -- and just follow my lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, we're gonna pry 'em out with paddles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil.  Our air's gonna crap out as soon as we get down there.  You know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess we get one shot at it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Swimming in his own blood, the Chief starts to fade away, losing consciousness.  But then, through the cockpit windscreen... A hazy orb of light above him.  The orb grows and grows until it resolves into a flare carried by his would-be savior.  Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd it have to be her...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Reaching the downed Helo, McCool and Cortez wedge their oars under the fuselage and leverage hard until... An opening appears. Jordan and Flea swim into the breach...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: ... and surface inside the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, sir... still with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unbuckling co-pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him first.  Once he's clear, come back with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, let me suggest you stop giving orders and start doing exactly what I say, because that's the only way we're all getting out of here.  Now how's your vest check out?  Still good?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: McCool's air craps out.  He abandons his oar and swims fo the surface.  That leaves only... Cortez, struggling mightily to keep the escape route open He knows his mini-tank is running on empty -- and it scares the bejeezus out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flea, take the pilot up slow, feed him air.  Chief, sir, you and I are gonna take the express elevator outta here.  Remember to let your air out.  Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twin transports -- Seafox One and Two -- pound across the water.  Instructors sweep binoculars, trying to spot... The ILB.  Newberry POPS A FLARE skyward as Slutnik DOWNLOADS INFO over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Cortez's air goes dead.  He gives it three more seconds, eyes riveted on the underside of the helo, knowing they have to come out... right... fucking... absolutely... NOW:  Jordan appears with the Chief.  Flea is at their heels with the co-pilot. Cortez drops his oar as if it were radioactive and swims for the sky. The HELO BOOMS back down onto the reef. Jordan yanks the cord on the Chief's vest.  It inflates instantly.  One arm raised, Jordan streaks for the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
