dialogues.text: ... and "Supermans" into daylight with the Chief.  They covered 50 feet in four seconds. Doing a 360, Jordan spots... Seafox One coming their way. Jordan waves like a shipwreck victim. Not slowing, Seafox lowers a recovery rig into place: They're wasting no time on the pick-up. Remembering the last time she tried this, Jordan gets a death-grip on the Chief's vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, sir.  I'm concentrating. The recovery loop comes at her like a big brass ring. SEAFOX THUNDERS past.  Jordan plunges her free arm throug the loop... And suddenly they're gone, whisked away by the boat. Throwing a rooster tail a mile long, Seafox pivots on the water and heads back to base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoooooo-yah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh!  That's right!  Just like we always practice it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limousine leading, a parade of vehicles reaches the base entrance.  A man exits the limo to expedite matters with the BASE GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator DeHaven is here for the graduation ceremonies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are all these other vehicles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a small press corps.  Routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that pickup truck at the end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That?  That would be the all-woman America's Cup team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Reconnaissance Class 118, you may now stand down. All buffed and polished and wearing their dress whites, the former trainees erupt with ONE GREAT HOO-YAH.  What began as a class of 100 now ends with just 40. Sitting among the families and friends we find Royce, smiling through his fears.  Not far away sits Blondell. No one claps louder. Jordan trades high-fives and fierce hugs with crewmates. Pyro finally manages to take her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant?  I was asked to give you this. It's a small case.  Jordan opens it to find a medal of bronze and blue enamel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navy Cross...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe he earned it for saving a man's life in Saudi Arabia.  He wanted you to have it.  He was very clear on that point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for him earlier, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief was granted early retirement as of 17-hundred yesterday.  By 18-hundred he was gone.  Out of the Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing better)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not my place to speculate on his private thoughts.  But I think the Chief knew that his way -- his world -- had come and gone. Jordan nods, understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeHaven.  She's holding a press conference, trying to tur piss into wine -- and doing a pretty good job:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... of course, we always prefer peace to war.  But if we're going to war, give women a piece.  Give them the choice to defend their country. And if the President doesn't like that idea -- if he wants to continue to deny women their equal rights -- then I'll be happy to step out back with him any time, anywhere... Jordan approaches.  Spotting her, the PRESS PLEADS for a photo-op with both women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan?  Jordan, dear... Letting silence be the ultimate expression of scorn, Jordan walks right past DeHaven... And joins Royce.  Together they turn and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, perhaps this would be a good time for that lunch.  Will the America's Cup team be joining us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Royce walk hand in hand, strolling the same beach she trained on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here we are again.  Staring three years of operational duty in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  It's not like you'd be completely out of reach.  And maybe we could call in a few favors, get you stationed at Norfolk instead of Coronado.  There are ways of dealing with these things -- I mean, if people are so inclined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is guy-speak for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yes, Jordan -- I'll wait for you no matter how long." Finally, the right answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START TIGHT on Jordan's face.  Even beneath the camouflag paint, we can see her exhilaration.  PULL BACK to find he in a line of commandos boarding an IDLING C-130:  She's embarking on her first mission.  KEEP PULLING BACK until we've lost her completely -- until she's just one soldier among many, indistinguishable from the rest.
